prime.gui.traits.IScrollable

type
interface
extends
IDisplayable
available in

Instance Variables hide inherited show inherited

container : prime.gui.display.IDisplayContainer

inherited from prime.gui.traits.IDisplayable
Reference to the object in which this displayobject is placed. It behaves like the 'parent' property in as3.

displayEvents(default,null) : prime.gui.events.DisplayEvents

inherited from prime.gui.traits.IDisplayable

isScrollable : Bool

Flag indicating wether there's a behaviour for scrolling the container or not.

rect(default,null) : prime.core.geom.IntRectangle

inherited from prime.gui.traits.IDisplayable
Rectangle which contains the current width and height of the object (without any strokes on shapes), or the wanted width of the object. For example, the resize effect will change the width in the "rect" property to make sure the background shape will redraw itself. For the moment, the size and position is only correct when it's set manually or by an effect. This due the lack of support for AS3 setters.

scrollableLayout(null,null) : prime.layout.IScrollableLayout

window(default,null) : prime.gui.display.Window

inherited from prime.gui.traits.IDisplayable
Wrapper object for the stage.

Instance Methods hide inherited show inherited

applyScrollX() : Void

updates the scrollRect.x position to scrollableLayout.scrollPos.x

applyScrollY() : Void

updates the scrollRect.x position to scrollableLayout.scrollPos.x

createScrollRect(w : Float, h : Float) : Void

disableClipping() : Void

Method in which the object stops listening to layout.scrollPos and layout.size changes

dispose() : Void

inherited from prime.core.traits.IDisposable

enableClipping() : Void

Method which should cause the object to start listening to layout.scrollPos and layout.size changes and apply them

getScrollRect() : prime.core.geom.Rectangle

removeScrollRect() : Void

scrollTo(x : Float, y : Float) : Void

scrollToX(x : Float) : Void

sets the scrollRect.x position to the given x

scrollToY(y : Float) : Void

sets the scrollRect.y position to the given y

setClippingSize(w : Float, h : Float) : Void

sets the scrollRect size to the given width and height

setScrollRect(v : prime.core.geom.Rectangle) : prime.core.geom.Rectangle
